isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - Meritor Transfer Cases MTC-4208, -4210, and -4213 - Disassembly - Front Input Shaft, Input Bearing Cage and Pump Assembly

svcproc.title: Front Input Shaft, Input Bearing Cage and Pump Assembly

step1.para: Remove the inlet oil tube from the transfer case by loosening the fittings at the lower front case and input-bearing cage (Figure 16).
Remove the capscrews securing the input bearing cage and pump assembly.

note.para: The high- and low-range clutch collar becomes loose on the shift fork as the input bearing cage and pump assembly is removed and may drop into the case. Shifting the transfer case into high range keeps the shift collar on the high-range gear, which keeps it in place. Also, shifting into high range allows easier rear cover removal on the MTC-4208 and -4210 transfer cases.

step1.para: Shift the transfer case into high range using compressed air at the high-range port of the shift cylinder (Figures 17 and 10).

figure.caption: Figure 17. Shift Transfer Case into High Range

step1.para: With the front input yoke still installed, remove the yoke, input shaft, input bearing cage and pump as an assembly (Figure 18).

figure.caption: Figure 18. Remove Yoke, Input Shaft, Input Bearing Cage and Pump as an Assembly

step1.para: Use the following procedure to remove the front and rear switch assemblies from the case halves, if equipped.

step2.para: Disconnect the air lines used to shift in previous steps (Figure 19).
Remove the high and low range shift cylinder from the rear cover of the transfer case.
Remove the outer shift piston snap ring from the shift shaft. Remove the shift piston (Figure 20).
Remove the inner shift piston snap ring from the shift shaft. Remove the shift piston (Figure 21).
Remove the capscrews securing the rear cover to the front case.

figure.caption: Figure 20. Remove Outer Shift Piston Snap Ring
Figure 21. Remove Inner Shift Piston Snap Ring

step1.para: Use the following procedure to separate the case halves.

step2.para: Use a pry bar to separate the two halves of the transfer case at the pry tab locations around the case.
Place eye-bolts into the rear cover lift holes located at the top and bottom of the cover.
Attach a suitable lifting device to the eye-bolts. Lift the rear cover from the front case.
As the rear cover is lifted, make sure the high and low shift shaft remains in the case by putting pressure on the shaft while separating the transfer case halves.

The rear output shaft and high-range gear are removed as an assembly along with the rear cover on MTC-4213 transfer cases only. The shaft is pressed into the bearing assembly which keeps the shaft retained in the housing.

step1.para: MTC-4208 and -4210 transfer cases only: Remove the high range helical gear.
Remove the high and low shift fork, shift shaft and clutch collar from the front case (Figure 22).

figure.caption: Figure 22. Remove High and Low Shift Fork, Shift Shaft and Clutch Collar

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. HIGH AND LOW SHIFT FORK AND SHAFT ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Remove the single-gear idler shaft, or rear output on MTC-4208 and -4210 transfer cases, and the double-gear idler shaft from the case. Remove the front output shaft, clutch collar, shift fork and spring as an assembly (Figure 23).
Remove the shift cylinder and push rod from the front case. Remove the two locating dowel pins. Note their correct location.

figure.caption: Figure 23. Remove Front Output Shaft, Clutch Collar, Shift Fork and Spring as an Assembly

warning.para: Observe all warnings and cautions provided by the press manufacturer to avoid damage to components and serious personal injury.
Use a chain and suitable lifting device to secure the rear cover in the press to prevent serious personal injury and damage to components.

step1.para: Set the rear cover with the rear output shaft as an assembly into a suitable press (Figure 24).

warning.para: The rear output shaft assembly is heavy. Support the assembly to prevent it from dropping during the pressing operation. Serious personal injury and damage to components can result.

step1.para: Press the rear output shaft assembly out of the rear cover (Figure 24).
Use a suitable puller to remove the rear output shaft outer bearing cone and cup from the rear cover. Discard the cone and cup.
Inspect the rear output shaft inner bearing cone and cup for wear or damage. Replace a worn or damged bearing cone and cup.
